cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles east of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Crawling north-northwest, then turning north-northeast toward the Mississippi/Alabama Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama state line (around Biloxi–Mobile area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River westward to Grand Isle LA, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with higher gusts possible at the port beginning Tuesday morning and lasting into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Lake Pontchartrain/Mississippi River corridor, which includes the Port of South Louisiana
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash and river flooding near the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip currents
